channel.title: science-fiction on Strat
channel.description: Recent content in science-fiction on Strat

item.title: Brave New World
item.description: Brave New World is a dystopian novel from 1932 about dystopian shit and it has a lot to say about the dystopia we’re currently living in.

item.title: Terraform: Watch/Worlds/Burn
item.description: A collection of science-fiction short stories that’ll make you go “huh, interesting…” and might encourage you to think about how technology affects your life currently and how it might affect it in the not so distant future.

item.title: Truth of the Divine
item.description: Aliens on Earth in the early/mid 2000s and everything that follows from that. Sequel to Axiom’s End, continues Cora’s story and adds some new fresh characters (alien and otherwise) into the mix.

item.title: Axiom's End
item.description: Set in 2007, the novel is about a U.S. government coverup of contact with extraterrestrial life. You follow the story of Cora, daughter of an exiled whistleblower, who finds herself in the middle of the whole ‘alien’ situation.
